      function OptanonWrapper() {
        var user = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('userDetails')) || {};
        const id = user.id ? user.id : window['pendo'].get_visitor_id();
        const firstName = user.first_name;
        const lastName = user.last_name;
        let targetingCookieValue;
        let dnpValue;
        const dataLayer = window.dataLayer;
        const GroupsArr = dataLayer?.filter((item) => item.event === 'OneTrustGroupsUpdated');
        console.log(window.dataLayer);
        if (GroupsArr?.length > 1) {
          const previousCategoriesList = GroupsArr[GroupsArr.length - 2]['OnetrustActiveGroups'].split(',');
          const updatedCategoriesList = GroupsArr[GroupsArr.length - 1]['OnetrustActiveGroups'].split(',');
          let FunctionalCategoryChanged;
          let TargetingCategoryChanged;
          const previousCLC003Exist = previousCategoriesList.indexOf('C0003') > -1;
          const updatedCLC003Exist = updatedCategoriesList.indexOf('C0003') > -1;
          if (previousCLC003Exist && !updatedCLC003Exist) {
            FunctionalCategoryChanged = true;
            dnpValue = true;
          } else if (!previousCLC003Exist && updatedCLC003Exist) {
            FunctionalCategoryChanged = true;
            dnpValue = false;
          } else {
            FunctionalCategoryChanged = false;
          }

          const previousCLC004Exist = previousCategoriesList.indexOf('C0004') > -1;
          const updatedCLC004Exist = updatedCategoriesList.indexOf('C0004') > -1;
          if (previousCLC004Exist && !updatedCLC004Exist) {
            TargetingCategoryChanged = true;
            targetingCookieValue = 'NO';
          } else if (!previousCLC004Exist && updatedCLC004Exist) {
            TargetingCategoryChanged = true;
            targetingCookieValue = 'YES';
          } else {
            TargetingCategoryChanged = false;
          }

          if (FunctionalCategoryChanged) {
            callDNP(id, dnpValue, user.session);
          } else if (updatedCLC003Exist) {
            console.log('0003 on');
            initializePendo();
          }
          if (TargetingCategoryChanged) {
            /* this timeout is added because Pendo allows only one API call per second per visitor */
            setTimeout(() => {
              updateCustomMetadataField(id, targetingCookieValue, user.session);
            }, 2000);
          }

        } else if (GroupsArr?.length === 1) {
          const updatedCategoriesList = GroupsArr[GroupsArr.length - 1]['OnetrustActiveGroups'].split(',');
          dnpValue = updatedCategoriesList.indexOf('C0003') === -1;
          targetingCookieValue = updatedCategoriesList.indexOf('C0004') === -1 ? 'NO' : 'YES';
          createVisitorId(firstName, lastName, id, dnpValue, targetingCookieValue, user.session);
        }
      };

    function createVisitorId(firstName, lastName, visitorId, dnpValue, targetingCookieValue, sid) {
      console.log('pendo create visitor');
      const request = new Request('/wos/pendo/createVisistor', {
        method: 'POST',
        headers: getHeader(sid),
        body: JSON.stringify([{
          visitorId,
          values: {
            firstname: firstName,
            lastname: lastName
          }
        }])
      });

      fetch(request)
        .then(async response => {
          if (response.status === 200) {
            callDNP(visitorId, dnpValue, sid);
            setTimeout(() => {
              updateCustomMetadataField(visitorId, targetingCookieValue, sid);
            }, 2000);
          }
        })
        .catch(error => {
          console.error('There was an error!', error);
        });
    }

    function callDNP(visitorId, dnpValue, sid) {
      const params = {
        'visitorId': visitorId,
        'dnpValue': dnpValue
      };
      console.log('pendo callDNP');
      const request = new Request('/wos/pendo/dnp', {
        method: 'PUT',
        headers: getHeader(sid),
        body: JSON.stringify(params)
      });

      fetch(request)
        .then(async response => {
          if (!dnpValue) {
            window['pendo'] && window['pendo'].startGuides();
            initializePendo();
          } else {
             window['pendo'] && window['pendo'].stopGuides();
          }
        })
        .catch(error => {
          console.error('There was an error!', error);
        });
    }

    function getHeader(sid) {
      const headers = new Headers();
      headers.append('Content-Type', 'application/json');
      headers.append('SID', sid);
      return headers;
    }

    function initializePendo() {
      console.log('pendo initialize');
      var user = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('userDetails')) || {};
      window.pendo.initialize({
        visitor: {
          id: user.id ? user.id : window['pendo'].get_visitor_id(),
          truid: user.truid,
          email: user.email,
          full_name: user.full_name,
          session: user.session,
          sp: user.sp,
          interface_language: user.lang,
          entitlements: user.entitlements
        },
        account: {
          id: user.customerId,
          name: user.name,
          environment: user.environment
        }
      });
    }

    function updateCustomMetadataField(visitorId, targetingCookieValue, sid) {
      console.log('pendo update Target');
      const params = {
        'targetingCookieValue': targetingCookieValue,
        'visitorId': visitorId,
      };
      const request = new Request('/wos/pendo/updateMetaData', {
        method: 'PUT',
        headers: getHeader(sid),
        body: JSON.stringify(params)
      });

      fetch(request)
        .catch(error => {
          console.error('There was an error!', error);
        });
    }</script><style>.section-with-left-nav header{display:flex;justify-content:center;margin:0 .9375rem}.section-with-left-nav header Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0021-8979&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS" data-ta="Sidenav-301-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-301-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 90 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (10) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.5048-5051 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec301AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>We demonstrate very high efficiency electrophosphorescence in organic light-emitting devices employing a phosphorescent molecule doped into a wide energy gap host. Using bis(2-phenylpyridine)iridium(III) acetylacetonate [(ppy)(2)Ir(acac)] doped into 3-phenyl-4(1'-naphthyl)-5-phenyl-1,2,4-triazole, a maximum external <mark>quantum</mark> efficiency of (19.0 +/-1.0)% and luminous power efficiency of (60 +/-5)</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" Furthermore, chemical doping of elements like boron and nitrogen in graphene gives rise to useful properties. Since chemically doped graphene is both of academic and technical importance, we have prepared this article on the present status of various aspects of this important class of of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1077-260X&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=IEEE JOURNAL OF SELECTED TOPICS IN QUANTUM ELECTRONICS" data-ta="Sidenav-304-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-304-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 24 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (3) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec304AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Transition metal dichalcogenides, a family of two-dimensional material with unusual electronic, optical, mechanical, and electrochemical properties, have received much research attention in recent years. Here we demonstrate that, another type of few-layer transition metal dichalcogenides, rhenium disulfide (ReS2) nanosheets display saturable absorption property at 1.55 mu m. Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0034-6861&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=REVIEWS OF MODERN PHYSICS" data-ta="Sidenav-305-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-305-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 82 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (3) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.1959-2007 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec305AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Ever since its discovery the notion of Berry phase has permeated through all branches of <mark>physics</mark>. Over the past three decades it was gradually realized that the Berry phase of the electronic wave function can have a profound effect on material properties and is responsible for a spectrum of phenomena, such as polarization, orbital magnetism, various (<mark>quantum</mark>, anomalous, or spin) Hall effects, a</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1613-6810&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=SMALL" data-ta="Sidenav-306-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-306-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 7 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (10) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.1322-1337 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec306AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The interactions of nanoparticles with the soft surfaces of biological systems like cells play key roles in executing their biomedical functions and in toxicity. The discovery or design of new biomedical functions, or the prediction of the toxicological consequences of nanoparticles in vivo, first require knowledge of the interplay processes of the nanoparticles with the target cells. This arti</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" class="ng-star-inserted"><div _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-307-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-307-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1613-6810&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=SMALL" data-ta="Sidenav-307-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-307-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 14 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (31) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec307AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>The development of effective approaches for the preparation of 0D <mark>quantum</mark> dots (QDs)/2D nanosheets (NSs) heterostructures, which have been proven to be favorable for heterogeneous catalysis, is highly desirable but remains a great challenge. Herein, 0D metal oxide nanocrystals-2D ultrathin g-C3N4 nanosheets (Co3O4/CNNS) heterostructures are synthesized via a facile chemical reaction, followed b</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" ng-star-inserted"><!----><!----><!----></tr><!----></table><div _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" class="ng-star-inserted"><div _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-308-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-308-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1550-7998&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=PHYSICAL REVIEW D" data-ta="Sidenav-308-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-308-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 86 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (1) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec308AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>This biennial Review summarizes much of particle <mark>physics</mark>. Using data from previous editions, plus 2658 new measurements from 644 papers, we list, evaluate, and average measured properties of gauge bosons, leptons, quarks, mesons, and baryons. We summarize searches for hypothetical particles such as Higgs bosons, heavy neutrinos, and supersymmetric particles. All the particle properties and sear</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" Zinc oxide has substantial advantages including large exciton binding energy, as demonstrated by efficient excitonic lasing on optical</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span recent three year period. Once graphene is converted into porous graphene (pGr) by a controlled oxidative etching process, pGr can be converted into a potential electroc</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-311-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-311-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1748-3387&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE NANOTECHNOLOGY" data-ta="Sidenav-311-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-311-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 7 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (9) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.577-582 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec311AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Colloidal <mark>quantum</mark> dot (CQD) films allow large-area solution processing and bandgap tuning through the <mark>quantum</mark> size effect(1-6). However, the high ratio of surface area to volume makes CQD films prone to high trap state densities if surfaces are imperfectly passivated, promoting recombination of charge carriers that is detrimental to device performance(7). _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-313-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-313-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1749-4885&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE PHOTONICS" data-ta="Sidenav-313-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-313-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 9 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (2) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.106-112 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec313AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Organohalide-perovskite solar cells have emerged as a leading next-generation photovoltaic technology. However, despite surging efficiencies, many questions remain unanswered regarding the mechanisms of operation. Here we report a detailed study of the electro-optics of efficient CH3NH3PbI3-perovskite-only planar devices. We report the dielectric constants over a large frequency range. Importan</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-314-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-314-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0028-0836&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE" data-ta="Sidenav-314-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-314-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 553 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (7687) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.189-+ </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec314AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Nanostructured semiconductors emit light from electronic states known as excitons(1). For organic materials, Hund's rules(2) state that the lowest-energy exciton is a poorly emitting triplet state. For inorganic semiconductors, similar rules(3) predict an analogue of this triplet state known as the 'dark exciton'(4). Because dark excitons release photons slowly, hindering emission from inorgani</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" However, the electron mobility of mono-and few-layer MoS2 has so far been substantially below theoretically predicted limits, which has hampered efforts to observe its intrinsic <mark>quantum</mark> transport behaviours. Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0002-7863&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=JOURNAL OF THE AMERICAN CHEMICAL SOCIETY" data-ta="Sidenav-316-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-316-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 140 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (5) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.1760-1766 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec316AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Excitonic effects mediated by Coulomb interactions between photogenerated electrons and holes play crucial roles in photoinduced processes of semiconductors. In terms of photocatalysis, however, efforts have seldom been devoted to the relevant aspects. For the catalysts with giant excitonic effects, the coexisting, competitive exciton generation serves as a key obstacle to the yield of free cha</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0926-3373&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=APPLIED CATALYSIS B-ENVIRONMENTAL" data-ta="Sidenav-317-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-317-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 147 </span><!----><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.940-946 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec317AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>We have achieved in-situ growth of In2O3 nanocrystals onto the sheet-like g-C3N4 surface. The resulting In2O3-g-C3N4 hybrid structures exhibit considerable improvement on the photocatalytic activities for H-2 generation and CO2 reduction. The enhanced activities are attributed to the interfacial transfer of photogenerated electrons and holes between g-C3N4 and In2O3, leading to effective charge</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" Aptamers exhibit many advantages as recognition elements in biosensing when compared </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1755-4330&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE CHEMISTRY" data-ta="Sidenav-319-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-319-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 3 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (10) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.763-774 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec319AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Solar fuel production often starts with the energy from light being absorbed by an assembly of molecules; this electronic excitation is subsequently transferred to a suitable acceptor. For example, in photosynthesis, antenna complexes capture sunlight and direct the energy to reaction centres that then carry out the associated chemistry. In this Review, we describe the principles learned from s</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-320-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-320-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=2058-7546&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE ENERGY" data-ta="Sidenav-320-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-320-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 4 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (8) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.690-699 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec320AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Due to the large number of possible products and their similar reduction potentials, a significant challenge in CO2 photoreduction is achieving selectivity to a single product while maintaining high conversion efficiency. Controlling the reaction intermediates that form on the catalyst surface through careful catalyst design is therefore crucial. Here, we prepare atomically thin layers of sulfu</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0009-2665&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=CHEMICAL REVIEWS" data-ta="Sidenav-321-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-321-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 119 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (5) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.3296-3348 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec321AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Metal halide perovskites represent a flourishing area of research, which is driven by both their potential application in photovoltaics and optoelectronics and by the fundamental science behind their unique optoelectronic properties. The emergence of new colloidal methods for the synthesis of halide perovskite nanocrystals, as well as the interesting characteristics of this new type of ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-322-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-322-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1748-3387&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE NANOTECHNOLOGY" data-ta="Sidenav-322-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-322-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 10 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (6) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.517-521 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec322AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Semi-metallic graphene and semiconducting monolayer transition- metal dichalcogenides are the most intensively studied two-dimensional materials of recent years(1,2). Lately, black phosphorus has emerged as a promising new two-dimensional material due to its widely tunable and direct bandgap, high carrier mobility and remarkable in-plane anisotropic electrical, optical and phonon properties(3-9</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1530-6984&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NANO LETTERS" data-ta="Sidenav-323-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-323-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 16 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (3) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.1546-1553 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec323AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Red phosphorus (P) have been considered as one of the most promising anode material for both lithium-ion batteries (LIBs) and (NIBs), because of its high theoretical capacity. However, natural insulating property and the large volume expansion of red P during cycling lead to poor cyclability and low rate performance, which prevents its practical application. Here, we significantly improves both</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1476-1122&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-325-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-325-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 13 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (11) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.1013-1018 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec325AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Photocatalytic conversion of solar energy to fuels, such as hydrogen, is attracting enormous interest, driven by the promise of addressing both energy supply and storage(1). Colloidal semiconductor nanocrystals have been at the forefront of these efforts owing to their favourable and tunable optical and electronic properties(2-4) as well as advances in their synthesis(5,6). _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-326-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-326-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1936-0851&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ACS NANO" data-ta="Sidenav-326-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-326-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 8 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (6) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.6312-6320 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec326AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Material that can emit broad spectral wavelengths covering deep ultraviolet, visible, and near-infrared is highly desirable. It can lead to important applications such as broadband modulators, photodetectors, solar cells, bioimaging, and fiber communications. However, there is currently no material that meets such desirable requirement. Here, we report the layered structure of nitrogen-doped gr</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-327-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-327-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1050-2947&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=PHYSICAL REVIEW A" data-ta="Sidenav-327-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-327-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 57 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (1) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.120-126 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec327AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>We propose an implementation of a universal set of one- and two-<mark>quantum</mark>-bit gates for <mark>quantum</mark> computation using the spin states of coupled single-electron <mark>quantum</mark> dots. Desired operations are effected by the gating of the tunneling barrier between neighboring dots. Several measures of the gate quality are computed within a recently derived spin master equation incorporating decoherence caused b</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1616-301X&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ADVANCED FUNCTIONAL MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-329-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-329-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 29 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (15) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec329AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Organic light-emitting diodes (OLEDs) have become a mainstream display technology in consumer electronics. Self-emitting ability, transparency, true dark tone, and capability of being made flexible are some of the features of OLED displays, leading to a superior performance compared with liquid crystal displays. In addition to displays, OLEDs are also a strong candidate for lighting application</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" class="show-more show-more-text" aria-label="Show more - Expand abstract for _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-330-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-330-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1943-8206&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ADVANCES IN OPTICS AND PHOTONICS" data-ta="Sidenav-330-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-330-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 3 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (2) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.161-204 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec330AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>As they travel through space, some light beams rotate. Such light beams have angular momentum. There are two particularly important ways in which a light beam can rotate: if every polarization vector rotates, the light has spin; if the phase structure rotates, the light has orbital angular momentum (OAM), which can be many times greater than the spin. Only in the past 20 years has it been reali</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" class="ng-star-inserted"><div _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-331-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-331-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1616-301X&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=ADVANCED FUNCTIONAL MATERIALS" data-ta="Sidenav-331-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-331-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 27 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (18) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec331AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Ultrathin MnO2/graphene oxide/carbon nanotube (G/M@CNT) interlayers are developed as efficient polysulfide-trapping shields for high-performance Li-S batteries. A simple layer-by-layer procedure is used to construct a sandwiched vein-membrane interlayer of thickness 2 mu m and areal density 0.104 mg cm(-2) by loading MnO2 nanoparticles and graphene oxide (GO) sheets on superaligned carbon nanot</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" class="show-more show-more-text" aria-label="Show more - Expand abstract for this record331">Show more</button></span><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="ng-star-inserted"><div class="kopernio-holder" _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-332-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-332-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0031-9007&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS" data-ta="Sidenav-332-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-332-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 100 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (9) </span><!----><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec332AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>We study the proximity effect between an s-wave superconductor and the surface states of a strong topological insulator. The resulting two-dimensional state resembles a spinless p(x) + ip(y) superconductor, but does not break time reversal symmetry. This state supports Majorana bound states at vortices. We show that linear junctions between superconductors mediated by the topological insulator </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" class="show-more show-more-text" aria-label="Show more - Expand abstract for this record332">Show more</button></span><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="ng-star-inserted"><div class="kopernio-holder" _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" class="jcr-link ng-star-inserted"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" data-ta="Sidenav-333-JCI-related-Info" id="Sidenav-333-JCI-related-Info" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0028-0836&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE" data-ta="Sidenav-333-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-333-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 570 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (7759) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.87-+ </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec333AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Two-dimensional (2D) materials such as graphene and transition-metal dichalcogenides reveal the electronic phases that emerge when a bulk crystal is reduced to a monolayer(1-4). Transition-metal oxide perovskites host a variety of correlated electronic phases(5-12), so similar behaviour in monolayer materials based on transition-metal oxide perovskites would open the door to a rich spectrum of </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" more</button></span><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="ng-star-inserted"><div class="kopernio-holder" style="font-weight: 500;">The Journal Citation Indicator is a measure of the average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0010-8545&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=COORDINATION CHEMISTRY REVIEWS" data-ta="Sidenav-334-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-334-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 383 </span><!----><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.82-103 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec334AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>A biomarker-based detection improves early diagnosis and subsequent treatment of diseases. Chemo/biosensing and bioimaging play a crucial role in biomarker detection. Ratiometric fluorescence (FL) probes provide built-in self-calibration for the correction of various target-independent factors and attract particular attention for analytical sensing and optical imaging. Based on the potential to</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" average Category Normalized Citation Impact (CNCI) of citable items (articles and reviews) published by a journal over a recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1748-3387&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE NANOTECHNOLOGY" data-ta="Sidenav-335-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-335-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 9 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (2) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.111-115 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec335AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p><mark>Quantum</mark> systems in confined geometries are host to novel physical phenomena. Examples include <mark>quantum</mark> Hall systems in semiconductors(1) and Dirac electrons in graphene(2). Interest in such systems has also been intensified by the recent discovery of a large enhancement in photoluminescence <mark>quantum</mark> efficiency(3-7) and a potential route to valleytronics(6-8) in atomically thin layers of transitio</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=1748-3387&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=NATURE NANOTECHNOLOGY" data-ta="Sidenav-336-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-336-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 8 </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-issue" class="ng-star-inserted"> (12) </span><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.952-958 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec336AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>Layered materials of graphene and MoS2, for example, have recently emerged as an exciting material system for future electronics and optoelectronics. Vertical integration of layered materials can enable the design of novel electronic and photonic devices. Here, we report highly efficient photocurrent generation from vertical heterostructures of layered materials. We show that vertically stacked</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" Study of the effect of the residual capping-agents on particle surface has unveiled various adverse and favorable behaviors in catalytic applications. In essence, while the capping ag</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0927-0248&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=SOLAR ENERGY MATERIALS AND SOLAR CELLS" data-ta="Sidenav-338-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-338-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 172 </span><!----><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.341-346 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec338AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>We demonstrate enhanced performance of solution-processed photodetectors composed of all-inorganic CsPbBr3 perovskite films with ZnO nanoparticles (NPs) decoration. Introducing ZnO NPs into CsPbBr3 precursor solution results in the film with more uniformly and compactly distributed crystalline grains. ZnO NPs can also promote the transport of photon-generated carriers from the central CsPbBr3 a</p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper recent three year period. It is used to help you evaluate journals based on other metrics besides the Journal Impact Factor (JIF). <!----></span><a _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" target="_blank" cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-jcr-link" cdxanalyticsaction="click" href="https://www.webofscience.com/api/gateway?GWVersion=2&amp;SrcAuth=IC2JCR&amp;SrcApp=WOS&amp;KeyISSN=0010-8545&amp;DestApp=IC2JCR&amp;UsrSteamSID=&amp;SrcAppSID=EUW1ED0E5C1EIFaMwUp2OdTninzqT&amp;SrcJTitle=COORDINATION CHEMISTRY REVIEWS" data-ta="Sidenav-339-JCI-learnmore" id="Sidenav-339-JCI-learnMore" style="display: block;"><span _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" translate="">&nbsp;Learn more</span><mat-icon _ngcontent-xgk-c256="" role="img" inline="true" class="mat-icon notranslate font-size-18 margin-top-5 vertical-align-sub material-icons mat-ligature-font mat-icon-inline mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font">open_in_new</mat-icon></a></div><!----></div><!----><!----></div></app-jcr-jci-data><!----></div></div><!----><!----></div></mat-sidenav></mat-sidenav-container></app-jcr-sidenav><!----><!----><span><span data-ta="Summary-vol" class="ng-star-inserted"> 284 </span><!----><!----><span data-ta="Summary-page-no" class="ng-star-inserted"> , pp.206-235 </span><!----></span><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><!----><!----><div class="abstract show-more-btn show-more-lines contracted ng-star-inserted"><div class="ng-star-inserted"><span cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" style="max-height: 50px;" id="rec339AbstractPart0" lang="en" class="ng-star-inserted"><p>This review highlights the recent progress of bulk and nanoscale coordination polymer (CP) materials for energy transfer. Artificial light-harvesting materials with efficient energy transfer are practically useful for a variety of applications including photovoltaic, white emitting devices, and sensors. In the past decades CP (aka Metal-organic framework, MOF) has experienced rapid development </p></span><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><span class="show-more-wrapper ng-star-inserted" dir="ltr"><button cdxanalyticsevent="" cdxanalyticsaction="Search" cdxanalyticscategory="wos-recordCard_ExpandAbstract" class="show-more show-more-text" aria-label="Show more - Expand abstract for
